items.sentence: Can you tell me anything about what\'s going to happen here today?
There isn\'t anything that anybody can do to avoid the inevitable.
How can anyone trust anything Tom says? He\'s a pathological liar.
The only time he feeds the dog is when his wife is away on a trip.
What he told us the other day simply doesn\'t make sense, does it?
Tom needs to learn Japanese, since he\'s going to Japan next year.
Mary asked Alice if she could borrow a dress to wear to the dance.
Tom was admiring my new car at the time the truck crashed into it.
I know you can play the clarinet. Can you play the saxophone, too?
I missed going out with her and eating at our favorite restaurant.
I told her once and for all that I would not go shopping with her.
An old friend of mine dropped in on me for the first time in ages.
Tom tried his best to move the table by himself, but he couldn\'t.
We have to figure out a way to make Tom do what we want him to do.
Tom is the only person I know who doesn\'t like watching baseball.
Tom isn\'t the only one who has to study. I have to study as well.
Tom wants Mary to take the medication the doctor told her to take.
Tom was able to speak three languages by the time he was thirteen.
Tom was adopted by a couple in Boston when he was three years old.
Tom was determined to continue his support for as long as it took.
Tom missed the last train and spent the night at an Internet cafe.
When I entered the room, I could hear Mozart playing on the radio.
Why are you worrying about something that doesn\'t matter so much?
Why did you ask us for help if you didn\'t really want us to help?
Why did you say you didn\'t want to go if you really wanted to go?
Sometimes it isn\'t enough for two people speak the same language.
You always said you wanted to become a scientist. Why didn\'t you?
After writing the letter, Tom put it in an envelope and sealed it.
I think it\'s unlikely that I\'ll be able to pass my driving test.
I wish I had tried harder to get along with everyone in the class.
If you were to win the lottery, what would you buy with the money?
Tom says he needs to ask Mary who\'s coming with us on the picnic.
Tom has been working in an investment bank for the last few years.
Tom heard somebody behind him and turned around to see who it was.
Tom held out his empty glass and Mary filled it with orange juice.
Let\'s get out of Tom\'s way and let him do what needs to be done.
Tom seems to be able to stay thin even though he eats quite a bit.
Tom tried to make sure that everyone had a good time at the party.
It\'s up to Tom to make sure Mary does what she\'s supposed to do.
For dessert, Tom ordered chocolate parfait with vanilla ice cream.
Tom tried to explain everything to Mary, but she wouldn\'t listen.
Tom doesn\'t like people to know that he can\'t speak French well.
I want Tom to ask Mary if she\'s planning to go to Boston with us.
Tom decided that it wasn\'t necessary to go into the office today.
Tom doesn\'t know it yet, but Mary plans to ask him for a divorce.
Tom didn\'t tell anyone that he\'d bought a diamond ring for Mary.
Tom didn\'t want me to tell you this, but he\'s still dating Mary.
Tom doesn\'t have to go to school tomorrow if he doesn\'t want to.
Tom and Mary are always arguing about how to raise their children.
Tom is going to take care of Mary\'s dog while she\'s on vacation.
